summary: I don’t know how many times I had to repeat myself in saying that the relationship between Sansa and Arya will not only be at...
body: I don’t know how many times I had to repeat myself in saying that the relationship between Sansa and Arya will not only be at the forefront of the story this season, but that they will handle things as a unit. That they will cover each other’s flaws, respect each other’s qualities and be in sync. Their entire storyline last season was built to bring them to this exact place where they are working together in perfect sync with each other. We are about to get the sun and the moon. The politician and the warrior. The she-wolves of Winterfell. It’s a time for wolves and there’s nothing you can do about it.

Their entire storyline last season was built to bring them to this exact place where they are working together in perfect sync with each other. We are about to get the sun and the moon. summary: At this point I don’t even watch Maisies interviews or read articles about her. I don’t think she’s ever done an interview that...
question: At this point I don’t even watch Maisies interviews or read articles about her. I don’t think she’s ever done an interview that hasn’t annoyed me on some level lol. She might be trolling but she’s burning bridges with the Arya fan base as she trolls lol. There are real girls (and anybody else) that relate to Arya and are offended when she gets called a monster by the woman that plays her. It amazes me that Maisie can be so good on screen and then be so off in interviews.
answer:
It just sucks because Arya is my favorite character so I’ve always wanted to support Maisie in the future with other roles for playing Arya so well.

But she’s just way too much now.

She doesn’t understand Arya’s character and hasn’t ever read the books to try to educate herself more. She’s the captain of the “let’s turn Arya into a soulless killing sidekick” part of this fandom and I’m over it.

Arya’s importance won’t be determined by Season 8 of the show. She’s the character with the most POV chapters in the books. She’s part of GRRM’s big five.

But most importantly, anyone paying attention can tell that GRRM has written her to be a main female protagonist, who only kills as a result of the trauma from what has happened to her family, and also has heavily foreshadowed a future romance for her.

tags: y'all pampered asses on Freefolk need to stop
summary: Don’t think I don’t see the Jon stans who out there being mad and annoyed at every and any character who doesn’t simply exist to...
body: Don’t think I don’t see the Jon stans who out there being mad and annoyed at every and any character who doesn’t simply exist to prop Jon up. Sansa’s opinions and actions were every bit as valid as Jon’s if not more so, and Arya calling him out on things he might do that may possibly endanger her home and family also makes sense. I know that y’all have been used to getting special treatment with all of the characters we’ve seen thus far suddenly lose their status as a major character when their story-lines intersect with Jon’s, but Sansa and Arya are their own people and they are just as important as Jon is, and they are going to voice their opinions (that don’t always align with Jon’s) while still impacting the story in major ways whether you like it or not.

summary: Some people are shocked or annoyed by the prospect that Arya might call Jon out on bending the knee to Daenerys. I really don’t...
body: Some people are shocked or annoyed by the prospect that Arya might call Jon out on bending the knee to Daenerys. I really don’t understand why. It is that shocking that a character who’s been portrayed as being wary of anyone who might possibly pose a threat to her home and family is fucking wary of someone who might possibly pose a threat to her home and family. I don’t understand how some of y’all even considered the possibility that she would be okay with the North being given to a stranger who has shown no sign of being somewhat competent at ruling.

summary:
Team Stark, fuck yeah!
I am here for a Stark sister team up! And anyone who calls it character assassination is wrong!
Here is a...
body:
Team Stark, fuck yeah!

I am here for a Stark sister team up! And anyone who calls it character assassination is wrong!

Here is a list of reasons in no particular order:

  • The season 7 Winterfell plot is bad, but I think with some tweaking it could have worked. However! Most people base Sansa being power hungry on Arya’s impressions and on the scripts. Arya thinks Sansa is power hungry (based on old impressions) and the scripts show what the audience needs to see, but it’s also clear from context that Sansa is not that (e.g. Defending Jon’s rule and immediately trying to give Winterfell to Bran, quite sincerely) I think a lot of plotting was done off camera and that was not great. If they’d made the gambit a bit more obvious or used Petyrs pov more, it could have worked a lot better.  Anyways, the whole Petyr murder outcome would lead them to be on more certain terms with each other (eg. no power grabbing and no face cutting)
  • As people generally point out, but now seem to conveniently forget, Arya saw the war and the Red Wedding up close. She was extremely traumatized by them. If anyone is going to be pissed Jon gave the North away, it’ll be Arya.
  • Just because you love someone best doesn’t mean you can’t be critical of them (a wild concept, I know). Actually I think Arya would be the most hurt that Jon did what he did, because she believed in what her family died for and she has seen the corpses of all her dead family members, sans Rickon and what Jon did, especially as her favorite sibling, would hurt super bad. 
  • Arya and Sansa are on the same page now, but I don’t believe that Arya is going to be Sansa’s biggest fangirl. They are very different people with very different life philosophies, but they’re going to support each other where it matters (not giving a kingdom away to a foreign invader/ breaking up the pack)

Is Arya going to completely turn on Jon? I doubt it. They have a deep bond that’s been demonstrated many times. But she will be angry and they will clash, because neither of them are the people they used be and they will need to establish a new rapport. 

P.S. Even if the AOTD are on their doorstep, people are still allowed to be upset their kingdom got subjugated. AGAIN. By another Targaryen. How are people not understanding this? THESE ARE VALID FEELINGS. ESPECIALLY IF THERE IS AN AFTER. YOU ABSOLUTE BUFFOONS.

summary: Like I get not liking something that a fictional character says/does but you bitches having a go at a real person over goddamn...
body:
Like I get not liking something that a fictional character says/does but you bitches having a go at a real person over goddamn fiction are honest to God garbage. People like you assholes aren’t even fit to be literal scum on the bottom of Maisie William’s shoe.

Do any of you even bother to read the dumb as a bag of dicks bullshit you type before you hit send? Y’all some nasty bitches. All because an actor failed to make all your sexist pig dreams come true. I hope all your nightmares for S8 come true.

Oh and P.S. you dumb pieces of shit, Maisie Williams is an A C T O R. She doesn’t write the show. I know it’s hard with just the one brain to share amongst you but this is just basic even for you.

tags: I spend the last eight years waiting for them to be reunited
and I'll be so mad if anything ruins it
summary: The bond between Jon and Arya is one of my favourite relationships on the books/show. Those two have been apart for all the...
body:
The bond between Jon and Arya is one of my favourite relationships on the books/show. Those two have been apart for all the seasons except the first two episodes. And now they only have one season to reunite and interact on screen.

If the show runners ruin their reunion and their interaction for the sake of ~cheap drama~ guess who is gonna catch these hands.

summary: It's their Fucking World.
title: It's their Fucking World.
description:
by Darkangel3198

She is the Queen and only a King was allowed to claim her.

Words: 1682, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin, A Song of Ice and Fire & Related Fandoms, Game of Thrones (TV)
  • Rating: Explicit
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
  • Categories: F/M
  • Characters: Arya Stark, Jon Snow, Tormund Giantsbane, Sandor Clegane, Samwell Tarly
  • Relationships: Jon Snow/Arya Stark
  • Additional Tags: Alternate Universe - Modern Setting, Explicit Sexual Content, Plot What Plot/Porn Without Plot, Desk Sex, Cousin Incest, Smut, Clubbing, Don’t Like Don’t Read

by Darkangel3198

summary: “It’s not often you see a character siding with Sansa who’s not manipulating her,” Williams notes. “Last season it was really...
body:
“It’s not often you see a character siding with Sansa who’s not manipulating her,” Williams notes. “Last season it was really tough for Sansa because Jon was thinking with his penis and it kind of made Sansa look bitter. This season you see Arya teaming with Sansa and sometimes calling Jon out.”

- Maisie Williams ( x )

reblog.comment:
“It’s not often you see a character siding with Sansa who’s not manipulating her,” Williams notes. “Last season it was really tough for Sansa because Jon was thinking with his penis and it kind of made Sansa look bitter. This season you see Arya teaming with Sansa and sometimes calling Jon out.”

- Maisie Williams ( x )

- Maisie Williams ( x )

tags: the lone wolf dies but the pack survives
Arya and Sansa are Stark sisters defending the North against all enemies
summary: Arya’s tighter bond with Sansa
title: Arya’s tighter bond with Sansa
body:
,This article makes me so happy. I never doubted that Arya would side with Sansa, but it’s nice to get confirmation from Maisie. I am so happy to read that Arya will give Jon sh*t for bringing D to the North. Arya is not going to become BFF with the dragon warlord nor will she be braiding her hair. Arya is a Stark and she will defend her sister against any and all threats. There is no doubt in my mind that D will be a threat to Sansa.

https://ew.com/tv/2019/03/25/maisie-williams-game-of-thrones-season-8/amp/

summary: Jon brought back dragons and thousands of men to save THEIR lives.... I swear if I hear one complaint towards Jon especially...
body:
I’m fucking sorry? Calling out Jon for WHAT?

Jon brought back dragons and thousands of men to save THEIR lives…. I swear if I hear one complaint towards Jon especially after he found out who is real parents are. Imma fcking snap!

Arya is one of my favs but I swear! (also what is this? Opposite day? Why are we pretending like arya wouldn’t take Jon decisions/opinions before sansa though? This is the same girl who stood up for Jon when all the northern shits were bashing him behind his back 😂😂😂 I’m just….

blog.name: outoftunemelody
blog.title: Fiction consumes me and reality is a distant dream

summary: If Arya gets reduced to a side character or Sansa's "tool for her dirty work" next season then I'm officially done with D&D....
body:
If Arya gets reduced to a side character or Sansa’s “tool for her dirty work” next season then I’m officially done with D&D. Arya has the third most chapters in the books and she has her own arc to finish. She isn’t a sidekick in someone else’s storyline.

The fact that Maisie was the actress with the most filming to do in season 8 gives me hope that she’ll get the screen time she deserves.

summary: But Lem was on her again at once, with his long legs that made one of his steps equal to three of hers. She twisted and kicked,...
text:
But Lem was on her again at once, with his long legs that made one of his steps equal to three of hers. She twisted and kicked, but he yanked her off her feet effortlessly and held her dangling while the blood ran down his face.

“Stop it, you little fool,” he shouted, shaking her back and forth. “Stop it now!” Gendry moved to help her, until Tom Sevenstrings stepped in front of him with a dagger.

reblog.comment: a Storm of Swords

And idk why y’all surprised by this 😂
